Australia: Louisa Lawson established The Dawn: A Journal for Australian Women.
Brazil: The Lei Áurea abolishes the last remnants of slavery.
Chile:
The Pontifical Catholic University of Chile is established.
Policarpo Toro ahead of a naval expedition takes possession of Easter Island.
The pirate Pedro Ñancúpel is executed in Castro.
Colombia: Carlos Holguín Mallarino is the 4th President of Colombia
France:
First Stage of the Eiffel Tower is completed.
Second Stage of the Eiffel Tower is completed.
Haiti:
President Salomon is overthrown; the Constituent Assembly installs a provisional government
The Constituent Assembly elects François Denys Légitime to the presidency
Indinesia: Founding of the shipping line Koninklijke Paketvaart-Maatschappij (KPM) that supported the unification and development of the colonial economy.
Philippine: A petition, seeking permission for a night school, is submitted by 21 young women of Malolos, Bulacan to the Governor-General.
Singapore:
Henry Ridley becomes the first scientific director of the Singapore Botanic Gardens.
The Singapore Fire Brigade was formed.
Taiwan: Construction on a Taipei-Hsinchu road begins
Tanzania: The German East Africa Company leases the coastal strip opposite Zanzibar from Sultan Khalifah bin Said for 50 years.
Vietnam:
Hàm Nghi captured and exiled to Algeria.
Emperor Đồng Khánh (1885–1889) ended his rule of Vietnam.
